Okay. (to Agnes) And don't forget to buy my cheese. He sits at the table just as Gabe stumbles in and drops t chair. Agnes takes the frying pan off the stove and start serving the eggs. Ziggy serves pancakes.
So-- Hey. Guess what, everyone. Good news. I've decided what I want to do with the Ellenville money. All eyes are on Gabe. He bangs a drum roll on the table.
Stop that.
That money is for college.
I'm_ going to take a year off and go to Tibet with Nicki. Agnes stops short. Louie stares.
I'll go to college eventually. I just want some time to figure out what- (CONTINUED )
Dad said that money was for a house for Ziggy and your college.
He said it was a gift. Agnes looks at Louie.
Are you going to say anything?
Travel is a kind of education unto itself.
Louie.
I did say it was a gift. Upset, Agnes puts the frying pan down on the table and st out of the room.
What’s her fucking deal?
Watch your mouth!
Robert is reading a book in bed, watching volcanic erupti on the Weather Channel. His PHONE RINGS. 152 EXT. BACKYARD. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - DAY 152
Agnes is lying on her back in the grass, looking at the m in the sky, her iPhone to her ear.
Hello? She hesitates. Not sure what to say. Finally:
Hi. WE CUT BACK AND FORTH BETWEEN AGNES’S BACKYARD AND ROBERT
(CONTINUED )
Mata. Hi. (CONTINUED )
Hello.
What's up? Agnes closes her eyes.
Happy Holy Thursday.
Is it Thursday already?
Holy Thursday. Tomorrow is Good Friday. Then Sunday is Easter. The resurrection.
I know what Easter is, Mata. I also know that you’re not the believer you once were. And that’s okay. You have to be kind to yourself. She smiles.
I like it when you call me Mata.
It’s who you are.
It was... It used to be. What are you doing right now? Robert sits up in his bed.
Nothing, really. As usual. 88. 152 She laughs. Then she puts her hands over her eyes, as if remembering something terrible.
God. That's the worst thing I've ever done.
Wait, what? What happened?
Kissing you.
Oh. Wow. If that's the worst thing you've ever done, Agnes, you're pretty damn lucky. (CONTINUED )
I haven't gone to confession. I don’t know how to confess this-- I’ve been telling lies. ROBERT ; You’re not lying at all. Everything you say is true.
(impulsively) I love you. Agnes quickly ends the call, regretting. Then she slowly to her feet.

Agnes cruises down the aisles of her local supermarket, selecting food and Easter supplies. --She puts a carton of eggs in her cart... --Then an Easter egg dyeing kit... --A bag of green plastic grass... --Some chocolate rabbits and Cadbury Creme Eggs... --At the cheese section, Agnes gets manchego cheese. Thin it over. Puts it back. --Agnes waits as the GROCERY CLERK scans her groceries. B BEEP. BEEP. BEEP. It's the same old routine, but now she no patience for it.

EXT. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - DAY 155 Agnes stabs the dirt with the statues to get them firm in ground. Then she walks out into the street to get a good at her work. She puts her hands on her hips and regards h house and the decorations out front. There's a new kind o critical distance in her eyes, nostalgia too. INT. DINING ROOM. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON 156

Tears running down her face, Agnes holds an egg in a wire spoon, dips half of it in a bowl of blue dye, and then di the other half in a pool of red dye. Finally Agnes pushes the eggs aside, and takes out the unopened puzzle portraying Goya's The Nude Maja. (CONTINUED )

She stares at the cover for a second-- it's a provocative sensual painting-- and then rips off the plastic and the cover and dumps the puzzle pieces out onto the table. INT. DINING ROOM. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - SUNSET 157 Louie and Ziggy enter through the front door, and find Ag just where we left her. The Nude Maja puzzle is almost do Agnes looks up at them in a fog.
Oh. Hi.
Are you okay, Mom?
Where’s dinner? She looks up, confusion in her eyes, as if not sure where is.
I guess I forgot.
You FORGOT to make dinner? What else did you forget? Did you forget us? Agnes stares at him.
I'll start making it in five minutes. I'm sorry. Louie sighs.
Did you buy my cheese? Agnes doesn't move.
You forgot that too.
(laughing) I did.
You think it’s funny? Agnes stares at Louie, as if challenging him. (CONTINUED )
What the hell is wrong with you?
Dad! Come on!
I slave all day for this family and you're sitting around doing puzzles! Agnes gives him a look, and then goes back to The Nude Ma Her hand hovers over the puzzle board. Louie stares shock
I'm gonna make dinner for everyone. Okay? Dad. Go upstairs and take a shower. I'll take care of it.
No. This is bullshit. Louie bolts toward the door.

If you leave, don’t come back. Louie freezes. Ziggy sighs and leans against the doorway, watching his mother fit the last piece of the puzzle in. Louie watches her too, unsure what to say or do. Agnes looks up at Louie, a tiny smile on her face. AGNES (CONT’D) It's done. I’1l1 make dinner now, dear.

location: DINING ROOM. AGNES AND LOUIE'S HOUSE

text: Agnes, Louie, Ziggy, Gabe and Nicki sit around the table, eating pasta.

A third of the population, something like 32% of India, live below the international poverty line. That’s $1.25 per day. How is anyone expected to survive like that? I mean, basic needs. Shelter. Food. Clothes. A long pause of pondering and/or awkwardness. Everyone ea (CONTINUED )
(re: pasta) This is pretty good, Agnes.

I've been thinking. Ziggy. All eyes are on Agnes. AGNES (CONT’D) Maybe instead of getting your own place, you could go back to school. Maybe culinary school. ; LOUIE ; Culinary school? You want him to be a cook? 92. 158 Ziggy, Gabe and Nicki watch like spectators at a tennis match.
He’s clearly good at it.
So what?
You think it's a bad idea?
Frankly, I don’t think it’s a very manly thing to do, is what I think.
All the great chefs today are men.
Most.
(to Nicki) No one asked you. Nicki recoils.
Most of the great chefs are men. Many.
How do you know that?
I looked it up. Online. Gabe laughs.
Yes! (CONTINUED )
(to Gabe) Stay out of this!
(re: Gabe) I think that if this little punk is going to Tibet, Ziggy should do whatever he wants with that money. Ziggy grins.
Punk?
(to Ziggy) You don’t want to work in the garage anymore? Ziggy shakes his head.
You want to study... cooking? Ziggy nods.
Cat’s got your tongue? Ziggy nods.
(to Agnes) You turned my eldest son against me.
No, Dad. It’s what I want. It was my idea. Mom’s just trying to-- Louie stares at Ziggy, disgusted. Then he gets up and lea the table.
Don’t wait up for me. He walks out. A beat later, we hear the FRONT DOOR OPEN A SLAM. INT. LIVING ROOM. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 159

Agnes is puzzling by the lamplight. She hears the front door open, and then a few seconds lat Louie appears in the living room doorway, drunk. They exchange looks before Agnes continues doing her puzzle. (CONTINUED )
Who gave you permission to turn my son against me? He’s a man.
You're drunk. Go to bed.

Goddammit, Agnes. You've forgotten how to listen. I’ve never done you wrong. Ever. Louie takes the puzzle and hurls it across the room. It shatters, the puzzle pieces flying across the floor. Agnes's face crumples and she sinks to the floor and craw around, collecting the pieces. Louie watches her, horrifi
Jesus. Look at you. Agnes keeps collecting the pieces and pushing them back i the box.
What’s going on? Who’s putting all these new ideas in your head? Selling the land. Cooking school. The puzzles. Fucking competition. She ignores him and keeps looking for the pieces.
You know what my father would do to my mother in a situation like this? He grabs her and pins her against the wall, lifts his han if to hit her. She watches in horror. He freezes.
That’s what he would do. I never did. I’m not him. I never will be. I’m not him. And he walks out of the room.
(to herself) Thank you.
Agnes looks out of the window at the approaching New York City skyline. (CONTINUED )
Next stop, Grand Central. Next and last stop Grand Central Terminal.

On her way to the basement, Agnes notices Robert’s desk i now messy, blueprints, magnets, batteries and plastic tub laid out. Clearly he’s been getting back to his work. She smiles to herself, somehow it feels like a small triumph. She hears a LOUD POP, like a gun shot, and jumps. Turns around swiftly to see: Robert with a champagne bottle in his hand. He’s just pop the cork.
Surprise.
Robert is pouring champagne into two glasses. He and Agne are sitting across from each other at the puzzle table.
To our last practice together. They clink glasses.
To you.
To you.
To a great Good Friday. She laughs. They clink again.
To getting all the wrong pieces right. They clink again and the champagne sloshes out of Agnes's glass. AGNES (CONT’D) I feel drunk and I haven't even taken a sip yet.
You're so beautiful. Agnes looks down and blushes. (CONTINUED )

Let's start. He dumps the puzzle out onto the table. Just as he does t Agnes clumsily leans across the table and kisses him. He kisses her back. They both stand up, embracing, puzzle pieces falling off the table. INT. BEDROOM. ROBERT’S TOWNHOUSE - AFTERNOON 163
Agnes and Robert lie under the covers together, post-coit
I decorate the whole house, I make a turkey, we have an Easter Egg hunt... Louie's family comes early. Then all his friends from the garage. And all the women from the Ladies Guild.
What would happen if you didn't go?
I don't know.
People would still show up, right? And your husband would have to entertain them. Agnes thinks it over.
And maybe that would be all right.
I can't imagine it.
Stay here. Don't go to the party. He strokes her arm while she gazes out the window. Then s turns to him and touches his face; his eyelids, his nose, lips.
I can’t stay.

I know. That’s okay. They kiss.  97. INT. BEDROOM. ROBERT’S TOWNHOUSE - EVENING 164 The sun shimmers down behind a distant building and disappears. Agnes sleeps in bed next to Robert. HER PHONE RINGS INSID HER PURSE. She suddenly wakes up, terrified.

Oh, God. He’s going to kill me. INT. KITCHEN. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 165 Agnes enters quietly through the back door, then stops sh when she sees Louie at the kitchen table. He's sitting there, very still, surrounded by party detri Agnes flinches, terrified.
Look, I-
Please don't make any excuses, Agnes. Please. I know you weren't with Emily. I called her. And Ronnie was here. Said he saw you at the train station the other day.
I was stuck in-
Please don't lie to me. Just please don't lie to me. Please, don’t-- Louie takes a deep breath.
You have to tell me. You have to tell me everything, Ag. Agnes regards him, her mood darkening.

I don’t have to tell you anything. I’m not your servant. You don’t own me. Louie gets up from the table and starts walking out of th room. AGNES (CONT’D) But I will tell you this-- He turns to face her. (CONTINUED )

AGNES (CONT’D) Don't make decisions about the family without me. Don't laugh at me when I care about something. Quit telling me I'm cute all the time when you actually mean I’m dumb. Help me shop if you want your cheese. Stop looking at me like I’m damaged goods or a head case. Stop snoring! I can’t sleep at night. And never ever, ever raise a hand on me again. Louie is very still.
Did you hear any of that? Louie nods, stoic.
Are you having an affair?
Yes. I am. I think.
You think you’re having an affair?

I have a puzzle partner. He’s a man. We’re a team. We’re competing as a team. We’ve had... sex. One time. And it wasn’t good but it wasn’t bad. He nods to himself. AGNES (CONT’D) Do you have anything to say? Louie hesitates, lets out a strange little laugh, then sh his head no, and starts trudging up the stairs to bed. Ag collapses against the wall, devastated.
Louie enters the bedroom, sits still on the edge of the b and takes a series of long breaths.
Agnes is on the floor, breathing hard, distraught.  167 99.
The whole family sits in a full pew and listens to the Fa Kutash deliver the Easter Sermon:

We began our celebration today with a service of light which represents Jesus Christ rising from the dead and bringing light to us. Christ light has shone in the world, scattering darkness forever. We had been waiting for this moment from the beginning. We heard in our readings today an account of the creation of man. And woman. This was in God’s eternal plan for humankind. But the high point is the resurrection; it is the greatest celebration of God's Church. This day is the most blessed of all as we heard in the Exsultet, the Easter Proclamation. “Rejoice, let Mother Church also rejoice!” Agnes and Louie keep glancing in each other’s direction.
The family exits the church amid the WORSHIPPERS. Louie starts to peel off.
(avoiding eye contact) I'm gonna go to the garage and do a little work.
Do you want a ride?

Nah. Thanks. Agnes and the boys watch Louie trudge away down the sidew his hands jammed into his pockets. INT. KITCHEN. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - DAY 169 Agnes and Gabe sit at the kitchen table while Ziggy stand the stove, making grilled cheese sandwiches for lunch.
Oh, and I also made these little tarts last night, these little mushroom goat cheese things... (CONTINUED )
Sage? Ziggy serv She nods. 100. 169
From scratch?!
Yeah. And everyone loved them. Oh, and I roasted the turkey in a different way. I used sage, too.
It was really good.
What did Ezster say? About me not showing up?
I dunno. She said something to Dad and then he got mad and told her to leave.
He did?
Uh-huh. es them sandwiches. They all eat.

There's this school in New York City. It's not that expensive but it's really well-known. You can get a degree in two years. And if it was okay with you guys I would keep living here and commute and then I'd still have a little money left over at the end. I don't know how long the commute would be, though. It might be too long.
Just an hour forty to Grand Central.
Really? That's it?
That's not bad. Gabe looks at Agnes curiously.
It'll be cheaper if you buy a monthly.  170 171 172 173 174 175 101. INT. BATHROOM. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - DAY 170
Agnes carefully applies mascara and a coat of lipstick wh looking in the mirror. It's the first time we've seen her dolled up.
Agnes rings the doorbell. Robert answers.
Ready? Agnes shakes her head no. He smiles.
A black town car drives down the highway.

The town car pulls in front of a flashy, decked-out casin with a sign out front that reads: WELCOME PUZZLERS. Robert jumps out and runs to Agnes's door. He opens it. S looks at him in panic. He offers her his hand. She hesitates.
I shouldn’t be here. This isn’t me. He gingerly takes her hand and leads her out of the car. lets him.
Agnes and Robert enter the lobby. They walk through the casino floor toward an entrance to an atrium where they s in at the Puzzle competition registration table.

Agnes and Robert sit down across from each other at a fol table, surrounded by HUNDREDS OF OTHER PEOPLE at identica folding tables. We catch glimpses of just a few of their fellow puzzle Competitors: --AN OVERWEIGHT COUPLE in matching cowboys suits... (CONTINUED )
(CONTINUED )

--AN OLDER WOMAN with half a dozen medals from previous competitions hanging around her neck... --Lots of KOOKY OVERDRESSED MATRONLY TYPES... --An OLDER MAN with a floor-length beard and a paper crow that says: PUZZLE KING. --A WOMAN wearing an American Flag sweater. --A COUPLE OF NERDY TEENAGERS. A WOMAN comes by and puts a paper bag full of puzzle piec and a cardboard box on their table. Agnes reaches out to touch it but Robert stops her.
(softly) Not yet, honey. She stares, shaken by that last word.

head_text.subj: THE PUZZLE EMCEE, A WOMAN, STEPS UP TO THE MICROPHONE.

text: Alright, Puzzlers, this is it. The moment of truth is upon us. Ready? On my count: Five. Four. Three. Two. One. BEGIN!

head_text.subj: THE SOUND OF HUNDREDS OF PUZZLES BEING FRANTICALLY DUMPED
ON THE TABLE AT THE SAME TIME FOLLOWS.

text: Agnes dumps out the pieces and starts sifting through the with her fingers. Robert, along with EVERYONE ELSE IN THE ROOM, has stood u and is walking around the table, looking at the puzzle pieces.
(whispering) What are you doing? Stand up! Agnes shakes her head no.
Remember? It's important to step away and take a-
Shhh. I'm working. (CONTINUED )
She's rapidly separating the puzzle pieces into groups.
Robert is now sitting across from Agnes and they're worki quickly, silently. He glances over her work.
You're not doing it by color. She nods and continues working.
You're doing it the old way. Agnes. What are you-?
Everyone else is doing colors and borders.
Yes! That's how we trained!
If we do it that way we won't win. We'll come in second or third. I'm doing it the old way.
Agnes.
If we argue about this we definitely won't win.
You're a goddamn rebel is what you are. She looks up for a quick second, smiling. She likes the i of it.
Agnes is standing in a corner of Robert's big white bathr making a call from her cell phone.
Hello. Is this an emergency?
Yes. Hi. (CONTINUED )
What happened?
I won.
(shouting)

head_text.subj: THE FAINT SOUND OF ZIGGY AND NICKI CHEERING AND YELLING I

text: I left a roasted chicken in the fridge. You can just heat it up and-
Don't worry about it. We can take care of ourselves. Tears unexpectedly spring into Agnes's eyes.
Okay. Love you, honey.
You wanna talk to Dad?
No, no, that's okay.
Congratulations, Mom.
Thanks baby. He hangs up. Agnes just stands there in the bathroom for second, in pain. Suddenly, A KNOCK ON THE BATHROOM DOOR.
Mata, are you in there? I need your date of birth.
What for?
I’m on the phone booking tickets to Brussels. Do you have a frequent flier number with American? She laughs.

183 184 105. INT. KITCHEN. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 183 Agnes tiptoes into the dark kitchen. She takes off her sh and leaves them by the door with the trophy. INT. LIVING ROOM. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 184 Agnes tiptoes through the dark living room towards the stairs. Suddenly she stops in her tracks and SCREAMS, groping aro in the dark and finally collapsing in a chair. A lamp turns on. It's Louie. He’s been sleeping on the co Agnes is illuminated, sitting in an armchair and cradling bare foot.
What happened? Agnes shakes her head, unable to speak. Louie comes close
Let me see. Is it a splinter?
(gasping) It hurts like hell. Louie crouches down in front of Agnes and holds his hands out. After a second, she gives him her foot. He inspects
It looks like a piece of glass. A piece of porcelain or something. It’s tiny. He tries to touch it. Agnes yelps.
Don't.
Sorry, sorry. Agnes turns the bottom of her foot up and looks at it. An she realizes:
It's the last piece.
Of what? (CONTINUED )
Of that plate you broke. On my birthday.
Oh yeah. Hold on a second. He gets up and leaves the room. We stay on her face. Louie comes back with a pair of tweezers, a bag of cotton balls, and a bottle of rubbing alcohol.
Here we go. He kneels down in front of Agnes again.
Now tell me if anything hurts. Agnes nods, biting her lip. Louie whistles slowly while h works.
Ooh... Getting closer... That doesn't hurt? Agnes shakes her head.
Ah ha... little bugger... It's almost out... Agnes studies Louie's face. It's full of concentration an tenderness.
tearing up) Ready?
For what?
I'm gonna pull it out. It may hurt. Ready for me? She nods. 185 INT. KITCHEN. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - MORNING 185 Ziggy is cooking breakfast. Gabe inspects Agnes's trophy.
It’s kind of small.
I got some gift certificates for puzzles too. (CONTINUED )
THE FRONT DOOR OPENS OFF SCREEN, THEN SLAMS. Gabe jumps u and goes to see what's going on. A beat later he comes ba
Dad left for work.
Without me?
Dal Ziggy looks at Agnes, who smiles at him.
Why are you smiling?
It’s his way of saying you can go to school.

The pickup truck travels down a country road. INT. LOUIE’S PICKUP TRUCK. MOVING - DAY 186 Agnes drives west on the highway to Ellenville. Ziggy is riding shotgun. Nicki is squeezed in the back with Gabe; reads out loud to everyone from one of her Shambhala book

“All worldly pursuits have but one unavoidable and inevitable end, which is sorrow. Acquisitions end in dispersion; buildings in destruction; meetings in separation; births in death. Do not dwell in the past, and do not dream of the future. One of Buddha's students asked him: "Are you the Messiah?" "No," answered Buddha. "Then you are a healer," said the student. "No," the Buddha replied. "Then you are a teacher," the student persisted. "No, I am not a teacher," said the Buddha. "Then what are you," the student asked, exasperated. "I am awake," said the Buddha.”
My father was the most charming, impossible man. Nicki looks up from the book. Gabe and Ziggy stare tensel Agnes. No one says anything. (CONTINUED )
(laughing) You would have loved him, Nicki. pause) Keep going, dear. Gabe and Ziggy exchange relieved looks.
I can’t.
Why?
I feel carsick.
Everyone is cleaning out the cabin together, clearing out the old debris and furniture. Agnes is carrying a big box out to the car.
Careful, Mom. Can I help? She shakes her head no.

Gabe unearths a mid-80s Frogger-type video game contrapti from under a pile of toys. He presses the play button over again over again, and eve time the VIDEO GAME THEME SONG PLAYS he and Ziggy and Nic dance to it. Agnes stands on the cabin's front porch, watching them through the screen door, smiling.
Agnes walks by herself through the tall grass, towards th creek.
The suns sets over Agnes standing in a pair of galoshes i the middle of the creek.  191 192 193 109. INT. DEN. ROBERT’S TOWNHOUSE. WEST VILLAGE - SUNSET 191
Robert is at his desk connecting tubing and magnets. His PHONE RINGS. He recognizes the number and answers quickly ROBERT 47° PHONE ) Are you all packed?
She's on the phone, still standing in the middle of the creek.
I'm with my family.
But you’re ready, right?
Yes.
Do you want me to send the car?
No. I’1l take the train.
Mata, you have to get to the airport at least three hours early for an international flight. You should be here around one. Security's going to take forever. Did you tell Louie?
No.
Are you going to?
No.

location: DEN. ROBERT'S TOWN HOUSE. WEST VILLAGE

text: Are you going to flake on me, Mata?
(laughing) No.
Good. I love you. (CONTINUED )
I love you too.
Agnes smiles to herself.
I miss you.
I miss you too. INT. LOUIE’S PICKUP TRUCK. MOVING - NIGHT 195
Ziggy drives. Gabe and Nicki are asleep in the back seat. Agnes gazes out the window at the passing night.
INT. LIVING ROOM. AGNES AND LOUIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 198

Agnes walks down the stairs to find Louie sleeping on the couch, a mask on, hooked up to an anti-snoring contraptio that’s pumping oxygen into his nose and mouth. She sits on a chair across from him and watches him, the MECHANICAL SOUND dominating the room. Finally, she gets up and wakes up Louie. He sits up.
re: contraption) What is that?
For my snoring.
But it’s so loud!
Should I turn it off?

Yes!! He turns it off and removes the mask. She laughs. The roo dead quiet. They sit there, staring at each other, inches away, with decades of marriage keeping them quiet and aware. Finally, Louie reaches over and touches her face with his hand. Clears the hair from her eyes. (CONTINUED )
Do you want to come up?
Please. She takes his hand and leads him up the stairs.
I love you, Ag.
I love you too.
Agnes drives into the Metro North parking lot, tears streaming down her face. HINDI MUSIC PLAYS ON THE RADIO.
Agnes gets out of the car, opens the back and takes out a suitcase.
The train speeds through Connecticut landscape.
The Train Conductor we met on Agnes’ first ride into Manhattan comes by.
Tickets please! Agnes holds out a twenty.
One way to Grand Central.
You know, it’s cheaper if you--

We move through a series of portraits showing Agnes’s reflections in the window with the lights changing as the train moves. She is absolutely fascinated by her own imag woman she is just now getting to know and like. EXT. ROBERT’S TOWNHOUSE. WEST VILLAGE - DAY 204 The cab pulls away leaving Agnes standing across the stre from Robert’s townhouse. She picks up her suitcase. Takes a deep breath. Can’t bri herself to cross over. She looks around. The sun gets in her eyes. She lets it. She tries to cross over again, but can’t quite do it. She suddenly sees Robert appear in the window. Alone, he seems even more handsome, more attractive, more vulnerable. He spots her standing there in the street and waves to he She waves back. He stares for a beat, confused. She shakes her head ever slightly. Alarmed, he picks up his phone and dials. HER PHONE RINGS She answers.
Mata, please.
I’m sorry. They stare at each other while on the phone; he - above i the window; she - down on the street.
You can’t do this to me.
I’m not. Not to you. You’ll be fine. He quickly steps away from the window toward the door.
I'll be right down.
No! Stay there. She sees him come back to the window, defeated. (CONTINUED )
They stare at each other for a long beat, listening to ea other BREATHING. AGNES (CONT’D) We'll be fine.

Agnes is sitting on the grass next to her suitcase. She’s been here for awhile. From time to time she closes her eyes and looks up, letti the sun caress her face. THE PHONE RINGS IN HER PURSE. Agnes watches the daylight moon above. Smiles to herself. She’s made her peace. THE PHONE KEEPS RINGINGShe looks around and we pull back see: TOURISTS, STUDENTS, COUPLES (YOUNG and OLD), STREET

head_text.subj: MUSICIANS, DOG WALKERS, CHESS PLAYERS, THE HOMELESS, CHIL

text: of all ages moving about. Agnes takes everything in. Then she fixes her gaze on a man moving through the crowd his phone to his ear. It’s Louie, clearly calling her, confused in this environment. She laughs, seeing him stop to ask a STRANGER for directi The Stranger points. Louie starts moving toward her. He finally spots her on the grass and hastens his steps. She stays still. Closes her eyes.
Agnes, for God's sake. Answer your phone. You said the east side of-- I've been calling-- Tears are streaming down her face, but she keeps her eyes shut. He softens.
I’m here. You told me to come so I’m here. What do you want me to do now?
Sit next to me. He sits besides her. She keeps her eyes closed. AGNES (CONT’D) Take my hand. (CONTINUED )
He takes her hand in his and holds it to his lips. Now he crying too. AGNES (CONT’D) Close your eyes. He closes his wet eyes.
What now?
Nothing.
Nothing?

Just this. For now. They sit there leaning into each other, shoulder-to-shoul holding hands with their eyes closed. The world keeps going around them without noticing. A sea humanity. The ultimate puzzle.
